description.value:
Trigger A brimorak urges the fire to spread out of control

Effect The bonfire becomes a forest fire and rolls initiative.

details.description: A @Template[type:line|distance:10|width:10]{10‑foot‑by‑10‑foot} bonfire spreads to the surrounding forest on each of its turns.
details.disable: A successful @Check[type:athletics|dc:22|name:Smother a square|traits:hazard,complex,environmental,fire], @Check[type:nature|dc:22|name:Smother a square|traits:hazard,complex,environmental,fire], or @Check[type:survival|dc:22|name:Smother a square|traits:hazard,complex,environmental,fire] check from an adjacent square is sufficient to smother one 5‑foot‑square of fire; each attempt is an Interact action. Dousing the flames automatically extinguishes one or more sections of fire, with no check. Water typically clears a 5‑foot square if the amount is small (such as from a spell like create water or hydraulic push). Larger amounts of water, such as a full bucket, typically douse a 10‑foot‑by‑10‑foot area (or 4 squares in some other shape). Throwing a bucket of water on flames requires an Interact action. A waterskin doesn't contain enough water to put out even 1 square of fire. Cold can also put out fire, but only if the cold can affect an area; cold is less effective than water, so a frost vial puts out only 1 square of fire, and a ray of frost is ineffective.
details.routine: On its turn, the fire spreads into a number of additional squares equal to half the number of squares the fire currently occupies (minimum 1 square). You determine the squares the fire spreads into. Any creature that ends its turn next to the flames takes [[/r (2d8+5)[fire]]] damage, or [[/r (4d8+10)[fire]]] damage if it ended its turn within the flames (@Check[type:reflex|dc:25|traits:hazard,complex,environmental,fire|basic:true] in either case). A creature can take damage from the forest fire only once per round.
